game_main

Class GameWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • game_main.GameWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class GameWindow
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The class GameWindow is the main class of this component.User of this component can extend this class and get game screen with game loop.The game loop is provided by MainThread class.User must implement 3 abstract methods of this class to make his game.The load(),update() and draw() method.
    Author:
    Comexetina
    See Also:
    MainThread, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method call load() method,add the key listener to the JFrame who contains this window and start mainThread.

      • load

        public abstract void load()
        In this method user initialize some objects and load images,spreteSheets and other content.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        In this method can add new objects,change parameters of objects,delete objects and do other thing to add dynamic to game.

      • render

        public abstract void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        In this method user decide which objects draw to screen.
        Parameters:
        g - graphics

      • draw

        public void draw()
        This method do all preparations before draw objects to the screen. It call render(Graphics) method every time.With this method user dont worry about preparations and other technical things. User only decide what to draw in render method. At the end this method show objects and release resources.
